result.execSummary:
The disposition of "Other" is used to indicate several different dispositions. The Charge(s)/Sentence(s) and Court Record Events sections of the WCCA record display additional information that must be reviewed in order to determine the exact disposition of the charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Certification of MOTION HEARING transcript commencing 01-08-2016 received and filed. (33 Pages.)  CH
Copy of transcript forwarded to:  ADA MARISSA L. SANTIAGO, DISTRICT ATTORNEY, SAFETY BUILDING, ROOM 219.
1/14/16 bail refund notice mailed to surety.

Defendant Leonard R Avery in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Marissa Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court ordered sequestration of witnessess.  Sworn for the State:  MPO Andrew Molino on direct and on cross examination.  Based on the testimony Court GRANTED the suppression motion.  State's motion for re-consideration and request for time to consider an appeal of Court's ruling denied.  Court ordered case DISMISSED.
Court order cash bail returned to the person who  posted.

Defendant Leonard R Avery in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court ordered case adjourned for dispositive motion hearing in Branch 19.  Motion hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Status conference scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Leonard R Avery in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is scheduled for motion hearing, Court is in trial and unable to hear motion today.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

- to adjourn, filed by the State.
Defendant's Motion to Suppress Evidence.

Attorney Michael J Steinle in court, defendant Leonard R Avery not in court, in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 7.  Motion hearing scheduled for 08-19-2015 at 08:30 am.    All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.

Defendant Leonard R Avery in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 07 due to the charges on the criminal complaint.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 05-14-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Any additional cash bail posted on this case to be returned to the remittur.

As an additional condition of bail:
No firearms
No dangerous weapons

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Leonard R Avery in court with Attorney Michael J Steinle.  Joanne L Hardtke, appearing for Karl Hayes, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.
